title: Covered Wagon Women: Diaries and Letters from the Western Trails, 1850; the diary of Margaret A. Frink
description: The diaries of women crossing the country in covered wagons, told of the ingenuity, courage, bravery, loneliness, fear, boredom, excitement and danger they encountered. Mrs. Frink tells of the Social encounters with Indians, the cholera epidemic, how they crossed rivers. What food and provisions cost and many other interesting details.
author: Kenneth L. Holmes
